p: Broad-spectrum antibiotic use puts patients at risk for developing Clostridium difficile colitis (CDI). A recent Cochrane review emphasized increased symptomatic cure with vancomycin when compared to metronidazole, fidaxomicin compared to vancomycin, and possibly teicoplanin compared to vancomycin [ 24] in CDI patients. Importantly, no recent studies looked at optimal treatment of severe C. difficile colitis [ 24].
